data.title: Hangman’s Chair Release “Naive” Video – WATCH + LISTEN
data.meta_description: HANGMAN'S CHAIR will drop their fifth studio album, Banlieue Triste, through Spinefarm Records on September 28 in all territories outside of France. A special double vinyl version of the album, featuring one black record and one red record, will be released in tandem. This comes as the result of a deal that will see the Paris outfit working with Spinefarm worldwide for…
data.text:
HANGMAN’S CHAIR will drop their fifth studio album, Banlieue Triste, through Spinefarm Records on September 28 in all territories outside of France.

A special double vinyl version of the album, featuring one black record and one red record, will be released in tandem. This comes as the result of a deal that will see the Paris outfit working with Spinefarm worldwide for future recordings.

Over the past decade or so, Hangman’s Chair– Cedric Toufouti (vocals/guitars), Julien Chanut (guitars), Clement Hanvic (bass), and Mehdi Birouk Thepegnier (drums) – have released a steady flow of singles, EPs, albums, and split releases. They’ve all been housed in signature, stylish artwork and have showcased the band’s trademark ability to blend emotional and musical weight with fragile interludes and atmospheric swathes of sound.

Hangman’s Chair stand as France’s foremost name in the world of stoner x doom, yet their music is in no way bound by style. This is evidenced by 10 new tracks on Banlieue Triste – from the epic riff-surge of “Naïve” through the shimmering, slow-burn instrumental “Sidi Bel Abbes” (featuring guitarist Marc De Backer from Wolvennest) to the soaring melody of “Tired Eyes” (a collaboration with French Synthwave master Perturbator).

The album is a body of work where brute force and beauty are never too far apart.
